title: Retro Latin Serif (50's?)
content:
Check out the font on 'TWO INCH TAPE'. I feel like I've seen this around a lot but I cant find any info on it online. Any ideas?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Font_4850.jpg)

Font: 

 Brothers by Emigre 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: propertyofparkdale

comments.content:
Good catch Ryuk.  
The record is post 2011 so it's almost certainly digital Brothers, which according to Identifont was designed by John Downer for Emigre in 1999. I note from his Identifont biography that he published essays on type history and hand lettering have in Emigré magazine and House magazine. Unfortunately, I have none of these at hand.  
Does anyone have any idea as to the source of the original design?  
The Myfonts tags included \_cigar\_ so I looked for matching lettering. I found an online image of a Tampa Life cigar box label from 1927 which looks somewhat similar toe Brothers:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TampaLifeCigar1927_4427.jpg)
  
source: [http://www.magazine.usf.edu/2011-fall/slideshow/history-preserved/tampa-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029/http:/www.magazine.usf.edu/2011-fall/slideshow/history-preserved/tampa-life-cigar.jpg "http://www.magazine.usf.edu/2011-fall/slideshow/history-preserved/tampa-life-cigar.jpg")  
Larger image at: [http://russellsshirts.blogspot.ca/2012/11/cigar-label-tampa-life.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029/http:/russellsshirts.blogspot.ca/2012/11/cigar-label-tampa-life.html "http://russellsshirts.blogspot.ca/2012/11/cigar-label-tampa-life.html")  
Anything else?  
Perhaps there is a 19th century woodtype? I note Brothers has catchwords, which were available as special cuts from 19th century foundries.  
I note Brothers is similar to Gin [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/gin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/gin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/gin/") a design at least partly inspired by gin and whiskey bottles.  
Finally, I see that what comes around goes around. The logo for a new cigar box -- Caja del Campion [http://www.cajadelcampeon.com/blogs/news](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317065029/http:/www.cajadelcampeon.com/blogs/news "http://www.cajadelcampeon.com/blogs/news") -- is a match for Brothers. The blog refers to the movie O Brother Where Are Thou, which which seems to use Brothers for the title -- with the alternate R, but not to the Brothers font.  
Don
